channel.title: Data Wrangling on Gabriel Quinteros
channel.description: Recent content in Data Wrangling on Gabriel Quinteros

item.title: Project IV: Clustering of server profiles
item.description: For this project, my client provided a database with a number of profiles which had a different set of profiles. The objective was: Clustering the profiles with similar accesses Selecting base profiles for each cluster For each profile that is not a base profile, get a list of all the accesses that differ with the base profile of its own cluster To complete this I used a machine learning algorithm called “K-Modes” similar to the well-known k-means but used for categorical data, that is, non-numerical data like text, characteristics, etc.

item.title: Project III: Suicide Rate Analysis using SQL and Python
item.description: An analysis of the suicide rate in the world using SQL and Python to clean and extrapolate conclusions from the data including a regression and an ANOVA test to see if there is a relationship between GDP per Capita or Sunshine level and the suicide rate. Data Loading and Cleaning Sources: Suicide rate (World Health Organzation): https://www.who.int/data/gho/data/indicators/indicator-details/GHO/crude-suicide-rates-(per-100-000-population) GDP per Capita PPP (World Bank): https://databank.worldbank.org/reports.aspx?source=2&series=NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD&country= Mean Annual Sunshine Hours (United Nations): https://data.
